intro: Paepalanthus neopulvinatus, commonly known as the Pampa grass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is known for its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of small yellow flowers. It has adapted to thrive in dry and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
